name: Homemade Green Chorizo
description: Here's a recipe for a vibrant homemade green chorizo that uses poblanos and serranos to really spice things up.  Be sure to use a fatty cut of ground pork.

recipeInstructions.text: Rinse the poblanos.  Roast them in the oven at 400F for 20-30 minutes.  You can flip them over once halfway through the roasting period if you want.
recipeInstructions.name: Rinse the poblanos.  Roast them in the oven at 400F for 20-30 minutes.  You can flip them over once halfway through the roasting period if you want.

recipeInstructions.text: De-stem and de-seed the poblanos, adding them to a blender.
recipeInstructions.name: De-stem and de-seed the poblanos, adding them to a blender.

recipeInstructions.text: Rinse the serrano peppers and cut off the stems.  Add them to the blender.
recipeInstructions.name: Rinse the serrano peppers and cut off the stems.  Add them to the blender.

recipeInstructions.text: Rinse the cilantro and parsley.  Twist off the thicker, bottom portions of the stems and discard.  Add the cilantro and parsley to the blender along with 4 cloves of peeled garlic, 2 teaspoons Mexican oregano, 1/2 teaspoon cumin, 2 teaspoons salt, freshly cracked pepper, 1/4 cup cider vinegar, and a splash of water.  Combine thoroughly.
recipeInstructions.name: Rinse the cilantro and parsley.  Twist off the thicker, bottom portions of the stems and discard.  Add the cilantro and parsley to the blender along with 4 cloves of peeled garlic, 2 teaspoons Mexican oregano, 1/2 teaspoon cumin, 2 teaspoons salt, freshly cracked pepper, 1/4 cup cider vinegar, and a splash of water.  Combine thoroughly.

recipeInstructions.text: Add blender mixture to 2 lbs. ground pork in a mixing bowl.  Use a spoon or your hands to combine.
recipeInstructions.name: Add blender mixture to 2 lbs. ground pork in a mixing bowl.  Use a spoon or your hands to combine.

recipeInstructions.text: Store in 1/2 lb. chunks using Ziplocs.  I keep one in the fridge where it will keep for a few days and store the others in the freezer.
recipeInstructions.name: Store in 1/2 lb. chunks using Ziplocs.  I keep one in the fridge where it will keep for a few days and store the others in the freezer.
